channel.title: Projects on Robert Hickman
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Robert Hickman

item.title: Could Yorkshire Win the World Cup
item.description: In 2018, after watching the CONIFA World Cup final live, I wondered if an Independent Yorkshire could win the FIFA World Cup. This resulted in a few blogposts that were turned into an article in Citymetric magazine

item.title: Guardian: The Knowledge
item.description: In my free time I enjoy answering football trivia from The Guardian’s The Knowledge blog programmatically

item.title: R Packages
item.description: In my free time I like to make various R packages for small things I work on. Here is a list of them.

item.title: Statsbomb Conference
item.description: In Summer 2019, I won the chance to explore a hypothesis in football analytics using data from Statsbomb. My final project looked at Markov chain models of possession value in football, and considering how to incorporate defensive risk into such models.

item.title: RInforcement Learning
item.description: Example answers to end of chapter problems in Sutton and Barto - Reinforcement Learning (2016)
